About Me

Hi, my name is Norbert and I’m a senior software engineer.

I’m most skilled in iOS development using Swift and Objective-C.

Experience

IBM Budapest Lab

Senior iOS Engineer

January 2016 - Present

https://video.ibm.com

IBM Budapest Lab was established in 2016 through the acquisition of Ustream, Inc. Currently about 200 people work in the Lab for IBM Watson Media, Cloud Platform, and Enterprise & Technology Security.

There are some highlights below of what projects I’ve been working on at IBM Budapest Lab.

Web broadcaster: I’ve organized a two-day hackathon to build a video streaming app for the web with WebAssembly to replace the company’s deprecated Flash based web broadcaster. The hackathon was successful, we managed to compile and use our team’s native video streaming codebase on the web.

Co-host feature: Our team of three developers created a co-host feature for IBM’s native macOS Video Streaming SDK. This feature enables content creators to stream their conference calls onto IBM’s platform.

Fortnite embedded player: I was part of the team which created a live video player for the Fornite World Cup. Our team received IBM’s Outstanding Technical Achievement Award for this project.

Chat client: I built an iOS client for IBM’s in-house chat platform. A few years later product management decided to replace in-house components with third party providers to reduce development cost, I also took part of the replacement project.

Newsfeed feature: With a fellow iOS developer we created an advanced video prebuffering feature for IBM’s iOS Player SDK. This feature makes it possible for content creators to embed any number of video players in a scrollable feed where playback will start instantly when it scrolls into the viewport.

iOS macOS Swift Objective-C C/C++ Video Streaming HTTP Live Streaming WebAssembly

Ustream

Senior iOS Engineer

July 2009 - January 2016

IBM Acquires Ustream

Ustream was a live video streaming startup which is now a division of IBM. Prior to the IBM acquisition, it had more than 180 employees across San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Budapest offices.

My first ever fulltime job. I joined Ustream at a very early stage, I was the 25th employee.

Enterprise app: I built the first version of Ustream’s enterprise app for the company’s internal communication product.

Complete rewrite: With a fellow iOS developer we completely rewrote the whole iOS codebase.

Media app for iPad: I was part of the team which created the iPad version of Ustream’s media app.

Live mobilizer platform: I was part of the team which created a platform for autogenerated mobile apps. This platform made it possible to create native mobile apps with a web based editor.

iOS tvOS Swift Objective-C C/C++ Video Streaming HTTP Live Streaming

Dual Display

Founder

December 2008 - June 2009

My first ever startup idea.

In 2008, after graduating from university I started to work on a startup project. The idea was to create an application that can attach an iPhone’s screen as a secondary display to a desktop computer. I built a prototype for Windows XP/OS X Leopard on server side and for the iPhone OS on client side. When I applied for a fulltime job at Ustream I thought I could finish and release this product in my spare time, but I never managed to get there for two reasons. First, Ustream had some really interesting challanges and in my spare time I started to work on those. Second, with the launch of iPad in 2010 the idea became much more obvious and other companies provided excellent solutions I couldn’t be able to compete with on my own.

There is a video in the projects section that shows how far I got with the idea.

Projects

Fortnite Video Player

Fortnite is an online video game developed by Epic Games. In 2019, Epic Games organized a Fortnite World Cup event for which they selected IBM Budapest Lab as the provider of live video streaming. We put together a team of three engineers from the Lab and two contractors to implement a live video player from scratch for the Unreal Engine platform to be embedded in the game.

I recorded the video below during the World Cup. The popup window is the published version of the Fornite game running our embedded video player, and in the background I’m running the same live content in my IDE to test that the two players are in perfect sync.

Math Solver App

This is an early prototype of a math learning app. I was experimenting with the idea of recognizing handwritten math formulas to create an app which is able to understand what math problem the user is trying to solve. The app would be able to guide through the user on the way of solving the math problem. At this point the app only mirrors what it can understand from the handwritten input.

Web Simulator

I had an idea to build a platform which makes it possible to embed mobile apps into websites. The technology behind the platform was a server running an iOS simulator instance, and the simulator’s display was being captured and streamed to the website. Events on the website was also being observed and sent back to the server (e.g. a mouse click got converted into a touch event). The video shows a possible use case where a localizable app is being embedded into a translation site, and whenever a string from the app gets a translation, the platform notifies the app about this event so it can show the translation in realtime.

Dual Display App

My first ever startup idea.

Augmented Reality

My master's thesis project built with OpenCV and OpenGL.
